intro: Callista trossula, commonly known as the Trossula lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of strap-like leaves that are dark green and evergreen throughout the year. Callista trossula is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its elegant appearance.
